titleStmt.title: De prædestinatione, sive, De causis salutis et damnationis æternæ disputatio in qua præside D. Andrea Melvino, sacrar. literarum professore, & rectore Academiæ Regiæ Andreanæ in Scotia, ... Christophorus Iohannides Danus respondebit.
titleStmt.author: University of St. Andrews.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the University of Glasgow. Library.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

div.p: DE PRAEDESTINATIONE. SIVE DE CAVSIS SALVTIS ET DAMNATIONIS AETERNAE DISPVTATIO, IN QVA PRAESIDE D. ANDREA MELVINO, SACRAR. LITERARVM PROFESSORE, & Rectore Academiae Regiae Andreanae in Scotia.
Deo Ʋolente CHRISTOPHORVS IOHANNIDES D'ANVS respondebit.
EDINBVRGI EXCVDEBAT ROBERTVS WALdegraue Typographus Regius. 1595.

div.head: REVERENDIS CLARIS. CONSVLTISSIMIS QVE VIRIS ACADEMIAE NASSOVIANAE NVNC SIGENAM TRANSLATAE, DOCTORIBVS ET PROFESSORIBVS PVBLICIS.

list.item: D. IOHANNI PISCATORI ARGENTINENSI. Rectori & SS. theologiae professori primario.
Dn. IOHANNI GOEDDAEO, Iureconsulto & Consiliario Nassovico.
Dn. IOHANNI PINCIER Physico-Medico & Archiatro Nassovico.
Dn. HENRICO CRAFFT Iurisperito, & Academico notario.

div.p: REVERENDIS ATQVE ORNATISSIMIS VIRIS, MYSTERIORVM DEI SINCERIS DISPENSATORIBVS DILLEMBVRGI NASSOVIORVM, D. VILHELMO ZEPPER, ET D. MATTHIAE PHOENIO,
PRAECEPTORIEVS ET FAVTORIEVS MEIS:

Hanc disputationem de Praedestinatione, ad testandum consensum in doctrine orthodoxa, & in signum amoris & debitae observantiae inscribo, consecro, mitto ex Regia & primaria academia Andreapolitana Scotorum.

div.head: DE AETERNA DEI PRAEDESTINATIONE.
div.p: SEV, DE CAVSIS SALVTIS ET DAMnationis aeternae.

div.head: THES. I.
div.p: QVando quidem visum est sapientissimo Deo veritatem huius arcanae doctrinae de Praedestinatione, siue de causis Salutis & damnationis aeternae, per Prophetas & Apostolos Ecclesiae suae patefacere ad glorificationem nominis sui, & aedificationem nostrûm singulorum: eam in Ecclesijs, & Scholis Christianis publicè proponi & explicari, ob illas ipsas causas expedit, imò necessarium est: modò sobriè & sapienter id fiat. 2. Timoth. 3. vers. 16. & Cap. 2. vers. 24.25.26.

div.head: II.
div.p: Sobriè & sapienter fiet, si explicatio omnis & doctrina intra limites Scripturae Propheticae & Apostolicae consistat, & ad huius solius normam (depositâ omni curiositate humani ingenij, ac iudicio siue preiudicio carnis) religiosè & sanctè exigatur: quod nobis in hac disputatione, per Dei gratiam, facere propositum est. Phil. 4. v. 5.6.7. 1. Pet. 2. v. 1.

div.head: III.
div.p: Explicationis propositae duae erunt partes: quarum vna pertinet ad 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , seu 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 : altera ad 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 sive applicationem & vsum.

div.head: IIII.
div.p: Praedestinatio, est (a) aeternum & (b) immutabile DEI decretum, quo ante tempora secularia in sese constituit, quid de (c) vnoquoque hominum fieri vellet. Vel: Est aeternum DEI propositum, (d) quo secundum beneplacitum voluntatis suae, ante iacta mundi fundamenta, hominum alios quidem amori & (e) saluti, alios odio (f) & exitio sempiterno destinando seipsum glorificare constituit. (a) Pro. 8. v. 22. Isai. 46. v. 10. 1. Cor. 2. v. 6. Eph. 1. v. 4. 2. Tim. 1. v. 9. (b) Mal. 3. v. 6. 1 Sam. 15. v. 29. Iob. 23. v. 13. Psa. 33 v. 11. Prov. 19. v. 21. Isa. 14. v. 24.25.26.27. & 46. v. 10. Rom. 11.20. Heb. 7. v. 17.18.19. Iacob. 1. v. 17. (c) Rom. 9. v. 20.21.23. (d) Rom. 8.28. Eph. 1. v. 9.11. Act. 2. v. 23 (e) Rom. 9. v. 23. (f) Act. 1. v. 25. Ioh 17.12. 1. Pet. 2. v. 8 Iud. v. 4. Apoc. 17. v. 24.

div.head: V.
div.p:
Praedestinatio à Providentia differt, quod Providentia ( 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ) res (a) vniversas & (b) singulas in hoc mundo praeordinet, disponat & regat: Praedestinatio verò (quae
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉
dicitur) specialiter creaturae (c) rationalis & hominum praecipuè vitam & mortem respiciat. (a) Gen. 6. v. 19. Psal. 14. v. 27. & 145. v. 16. Isa. 45.7. (b) Gen. 45.8. & 50. v. 20 Exod. 4. v. 11. Ios. 11. v. 6. 2. Sam. 12. v. 12. & 16. v. 10. 1. Reg. 22.20. Prov. 21. v. 1. Dan. 4. v. 32. (c) Exod. 33.19 Iob. 12. v. 16.17. Psal. 105.25. Prou. 16. v. 4. Eccles. 7.13. Iere. 13. v. 25. Ezech. 36. v. 26.

div.head: VI.
div.p: In hoc Praedestinationis Decreto duae summae & communes causae considerandae imprimis veniunt, Efficiens & Finalis.

div.head: VII.
div.p: Efficiens suprema & communis est (a) voluntas DEI, cum decreto ipsias aeterno & immutabili coniuncta. Siue, beneplacitum DEI secundum propositum eius qui omnia efficit ex (b) consilio voluntatis suae. (a) Mat. 7. v. 21. cap. 12. v. ult. Ioh 6. v. 39. Rom. 12. v. 2. Col. 1. v. 9. 1. Thes. 4.3. (b) Psa. 33. v. 11. Isa. 14. v. 26.27. &. 19. v. 17.18. & 28. v. ult. & 46. v. 10. Iere. 32. v. 19. & 50. v. 44.45. Act. 2.23. Ephes. 1. v. 5. & 11.

div.head: VIII.
div.p: Voluntatem siue (a) beneplacitum DEI supremam causam Praedestinationis dicimus: quia (b) Scriptura supra hanc nullam aliā causam nobis proponit, & fides simul cum scriptura in hac vnica causa nos acquiescere iubet. Ita vt huius causae (c) causam quaerere, temerariae sit audaciae ac impiae curiositatis. (a) Rom. 8. v. 29. Mat. 11. v. 25.26. Rom. 9.18. (b) Mal. 1. v. 23. Isai. 45. v. 9.10.11.12. Ier. 18.6. 2. Tim. 2. v. 20. (c) Rom. 11.33.34, 35. & cap. 9. v. 14, 15, 16, 17 18, 19, Sap. 1. v. 3.

div.head: IX.
div.p: Communem autem causam dicimus: quod ad vtram{que} Praedestinationis differentiam siue speciem, Electionem & Reprobationē, de quibus mox dicendum, communiter spectet

div.head: X.
div.p: Finis autem summus & communis est, (a) Gloria DEI. I. Gloria gratiae, (b) misericordiae & (c) Iustitiae DEI, quam in alijs in Christo adoptandis & seruandis declarare voluit. II. Gloria Iustitiae & (d) potentiae suae in alijs iusto iudicio condemnandis. III. Deni{que} gloria liberrimae (e) potestatis, tum in seruandis, tum abdicandis. (a) Prou. 16, v. 4, (b) Eph. 1, v. 6, 12, Rom. 9, 23, (c) Rom. 3, v. 25, 26, (d) Rom. 9, 17 & 22. (e) Rom. 9, v, 15, 18, 20, 21.

div.head: XI.
div.p: Secundum duos illos priores fines, & duo (a) hominum genera in quibus gratiam vel severitatem suam ostendere constituit DEVS, duae sunt Praedestinationis species sive differentiae, Electio & Reprobatio. (a) Psal. 1. v. 6, & 37. v. 28. & 105. v. 6. & 33. v. 12. & 65. v. 5. & 106. v. 4.5. 2. Pet. 2. v. 9.

div.head: XII.
div.p: Duas autem esse Praedestinationis species ex Scriptura manifestum est, & duos tantum esse hominum ordines: alios nimirum Electos & seruandos (quorum numerus vt certus est & (a) finitus: ita soli (b) DEO notus) alios Reprobos & in aeternum abdicandos: (quorum numerus quoque certus est & desinitus DEO) & ex quorum numero est maior (c) Mundi pars, & ideò Mundi (d) nomine saepè appellantur. (a) Isai. 53. v. 11. Iohn 10. v. 11.27.28.29.30. & 17. v. 2.6.9.10.24. Isai. 10. v. 22. Rom. 8. v. 14. & 9.27, & 11. v. 7 (b) 1. Reg. 19 v. 18. Rom. 11. v. 3.4. 2. Tim. 2. v. 19. (c) Mat. 22. v. 14. Mar. 12. v. 13. Luc. 20. v. 20. (d) Iohn 14. v. 17. 19. 22. & Cap. 15. v. 18.19. & 17. v. 6.9.14.15. &c.

div.head: XIII.
div.p: Caeterum Electio & Reprobatio propriè quidem ad hominis conditionem iam conditi & lapsu corrupti referuntur, ita vt per electionem significetur temporalis (a) separatio quorundam hominum, è perdito genere humano per vocationem è tenebris (b) ad lucem: per Reprobationem verò significetur praeteritio siue reiectio aliorum, qui sibi & suo vitio relicti (c) à Deo abdicantur: sed Metonymicè pro ipso Eligendi & Reprobandi aeterno decreto accipiuntur. (a) Mat. 3. vers. 12. Luc. 3. v. 17. Iohn 17. v. 6. (b) Isai. 9. v. 2. (c) Isai. 6. v. 9. Mat. 13. v. 14. Marc. 4. v. 12, Luc. 8. v. 10. Act. 28. v. 26.

div.head: XIIII.
div.p:
Electio est Praedestinatio quorundam hominum in Christo ad vitam aeternam: qua scilicet DEVS volens manifestare
gloriam gratiae suae ex sola 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , constituit certos aliquos homines gratis in Christo adoptare, vt in ipso sint participes caelestis haereditatis & vitae aeternae. Ephes. 1. v. 5.6. Mat. 22. v. 14. Rom. 8. v. 28. & 9. v. 21. Luc. 10. v. 20. Act. 13. v. 48. Philip. 4. v. 3. Apoc. 3. v. 5. & 21. v. 27.

div.head: XV.
div.p: Causa efficiens Impulsiua siue 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 dicitur sola 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 se solum respiciens omnem aliam (a) externam causam excludens, quae sit aut esse possit in hominibus, praeuisae fidei, dignit atis, sanctitatis, aut bonorum operum, &c. (a) Ephes. 1. v. 4.9. & Cap. 2. v. 10. Eph. 1. v. 5. Ioh. 1. v. 12. Tit. 3. v. 5.

div.head: XVI.
div.p: Falsissimum ergo est dogma tum Pelagianorum, tum Semi-pelagianorum, qui extra Deum causas salutis humanae in hominibus ipsis comminiscuntur. Sic enim & certitudinem salutis nostrae convellunt, quae in vnica DEI miserentis gratia ita certa est & firma, vt impossibile (a) sit Electos ea excidere, & Deum gloria gratiae ac misericordiae suae dispoliant: Cui laus et gloria in Electione nostra soli, in solidum debetur. (a) Ioh. 17. v. 2.6.9.11.12.19.20.24. & Cap. 10. v. 27.28. 29. Luc. 22. v. 31.32. Psa. 51. v. 13. 2. Sam, 7. v. 14.15. Confer. Psal. 1. v. 3. &c.

div.head: XVII.
div.p: Enimverò nihil dignitatis aut boni in hominibus praevidere potuit DEVS, qui naturâ sunt (a) hostes DEI, Filij (b) irae, mortui in (c) peccatis, inutiles vel ad cogitandum aliquid (d) boni tanquam ex semetipsis. Denique in quibus nihil est per naturam, praeter materiam (e) mortis & damnationis aternae. (a) Rom. 5, v. 10, (b) Eph. 2, v. 3. (c) Rom. 7, v. 10 Col. 2, 13, Heb. 9, 14, Eph. 2, 1 (d) 2, Cor. 3, 5, (e) Iob. 15 v. 14, 15, 16, Psal. 14, 3, & 143, 2, Iere. 10, 23.

div.head: XVIII.
div.p: Quod si ex praevisa fide nostra, sanctitate, aut operibus nostris esset Electio: Fides (a) esset à nobis, non à DEO, & sequeretur nos DEVM priús (b) dilexisse & elegisse: quae falsa esse & absurda Scriptura demonstrat. Et locus ille de nondum natis pueris Esa • co & Iacobo, quum nihil fecissent boni vel mali inter alia euidens est, contra fictitiam istam et scripturae ignoratam Praescientiam. Rom. 9. v. 11, & deinceps, (a) Ioh. 3. v. 3.5.6.7.8. (b) Ioh. 6. v. 37. Cap. 8. v. 47. & 10. v. 26. Act. 13. v. 48. Tit. 1. v. 1. 2. Thes. 3. v. 2. Mat. 16. v. 17. Ephes. 2. v. 8. Ioh 6. v. 45. Act. 16. v. 14. (c) 1. Ioh. 4. v. 9.10. &c. & Cap. 15. v. 16.

div.head: XIX.
div.p: Cum Apostolo igitur asserimus DEVM antequam iacerentur fundamenta Mundi nos elegisse vt Sancti essemus, non autem, quia sanctos futuros praevidit tanquam ex operibus nostris. Neque elegit dignos, sed eligendo dignos facit, inquit rectissimè Augustinus lib. 5. cont. Iulian. Confer. Ioh. 15. v. 16. Ephes. 1. v. 4. Tit. 3. v. 4.5.6.7.

div.head: XX.
div.p:
Fundamentum Electionis & Salutis nostrae est in solo merito & vnica efficacia obedientiae passiuae, seu passionis & (a) mortis Iesu Christi. Quos enim seruare decreuit DEVS, eosdem Christo dare & inserere constituit, neque est in ali •
(b) quoquam Salus. (a) 1, Corinth. 3, v. 11, Mat. 20, v. 28, & 26. v. 28. Luc. 22. v. 20. Ioh. 1. v. 29. Act. 20. v. 28. Rom. 3. v. 14.25. & 5. v. 9.10. & 8. v. 3. Gal. 3. v. 13. Tit. 2. v. 14. Heb. 2. v. 14.15. & 9. v. 12.14.22.26. & 10. v. 10.12.14.19. 1. Pet. 1. v. 19. 1. Pet. 2. v. 4. 1. Pet. 3. v. 18. 1. Ioh. 1. v. 7. & 2. Cap. v. 2. 1. Ioh. 1. v. 7. Apocal. 1. v. 5. (b) Act. 4. v. 12.

div.head: XXI.
div.p:
Et in quo DEVS summam gratiam & misericordiam, & summam pariter severitatem & iustitiam demonstravit.
Summam gratiam & misericordiam erga nos, dum gratis & misericorditer condonatis peccatis nostris in illo nobis donat vitam. Severitatem verò Iustitiae suae, dum proprio filio propter nos non pepercit, sed peccata nostra severè vltus est in illo. Exod. 34. v. 6.7 Psal. 5. v. 56. Ioh. 3. v. 14.15. 2. Cor. 5. vers. vlt.

div.head: XXII.
div.p: Finis proprius est salus, vita, & glorificatio Electorum: Subordinatus ille quidem summo & principali fini nempe gloriae DEI eligentis. Colos. 1, v. 12.13, 2. Thes. 2. vers. 13.14. &c.

div.head: XXIII.
div.p: Porrò prout DEVS praedestinauit nos ad hunc finem: ita etiam ad media (a) omnia, per qua tanquam per gradus executionem summi illius decreti ad suum finem perduci constituit. (a) Rom. 1. v. 16. & Cap. 18. v. 17. 1 Cor. 3. v. 5. 1. Pet. 1. v. 23. & 25.

div.head: XXIIII.
div.p: Media per quae progreditur Decreti executio, alia sunt communia tum Electioni, tum Reprobationi: alia propria. Communia sunt Creatio hominis in sanctitate (a) & iustitia vera, lapsus & lapsum insecuta (b) corruptio totius generis humani: ex quo visum est Deo alios sibimet separare & eligere ad vitam, alios verò incorruptione relictos praeterire. (a) Gen. 1. v. 26.27. & 31. Eccles. 7. v. 29. (b) Genes. 3. per totum & Cap. 5. v. 3. Rom. 5. v. 12. 1. Cor. 15. v. 49. 50. &c.

div.head: XXV.
div.p:
Propria Electionis sunt praecipuè ista: Vocatio efficax per fidem, Iustificatio, Sanctificatio, Glorificatio: sub quibus reliqui fidei & Regenerationis fructus omnes continētur: quam catenam verè auream nectit & demonstrat Apostolus. Rom. 8, v. 29.30. Confer. Rom. 8. v. 38.39. Ioh. 10. v. 28. Rom. 11. v. 29, Luc. 22. v. 32. 1. Pet. 1. v. 5. & 23. 1. Ioh. 2.
v. 19. 2. Tim. 2. v. 19. Psal. 1. v. 3. Esai. 42. v. 3. Iere. 32. v. 40, Osea. 2. v. 19. & 20. Marc. 9. v. 24. Psal. •• .

div.head: XXVI.
div.p: Reprobatio est qua Deus ab aeterno constituit quosdam in Adamo corruptos & sibi relictos morti & exitio aeterno adiudicare, vt in his vasis ignominiae coagmentatis ad interitum notam faceret gloriam tum Iustitiae, tum potentiae suae, Prov. 16. v. 4. Exo. 9. v. 16. Rom. 9. v. 22. 2. Pet. 2. v. 4. Iob. 4. v. 18. & 19. v. 15. Iud. v. 4. Apoc. 13. v. 8. & 17. v. 8. & 20. vers. 15.

div.head: XXVII.
div.p: Hîc homo impiè tumultuatur & insurgit adversus Deum, feu lutum sumens sibi iudicium de figulo suo, accusans Deum iniustitiae & crudelitatis: Sed hanc calumniam iniustam esse: neque vllam esse iniustitiam aut crudelitatem in Deo manifestum est, si vel Deum intueamur, sive homines ipsos, & media per quae decretum istud in hominibus perficitur. Mal. 1. v. 2. Isa. 45. v. 9.10.11.12. Iere. 18. v. 6. 2. Tim. 2. v. 20.

div.head: XXVIII.
div.p: DEVS vt in omnes creaturas, ita in hominem summam & liberrimam obtinet proprio suo iure potestatem, seu Figulus in lutum. Annon Figulus habet potestatem in lutum, vt ex eadem massa faciat aliud quidem vas ad decus, aliud ad dedecus: Tu igitur O homo! tu quis es qui ex adversort-sponsas DEO? Rom. 9. v. 14.15.16.18.19.20.21.

div.head: XXIX.
div.p: Iustissimum porrò esse hoc Decretum liquet ex medijs & gradibus tum communibus, tum proprijs, per quos Reprobi progrediendo causa sibi ipsi sunt iustissimae condemnationis, Iob. 12. v. 17. Psal. 7. v. 16. & 9. v. 16.17. & 10. v. 2. & 57. v. 7. & 5 • . v. 4.

div.head: XXX.
div.p: Communia media sunt illa ipsa de quibus suprà, nimirum creatio in integritate, & iustitia, à qua homines sponte & liberrima voluntate defecerunt, deficiendo Deum offenderunt seipsos corruperunt, & iudicium ac exitium sibi ipsis suapte culpa attraxerunt. Prov. 5. v. 22. & 11. v. 6. 27, & 12, v. 26. & 22. v. 8. & 26. v. 27. & 29. v. 6. Eccles. 10. v. 8. Esa. 33. v. 11.

div.head: XXXI.
div.p: Adhaec accedunt propria media, videlicet in naturali corruptione derelictio, infidelitas, inefficax aut nulla vocatio, induratio in peccatis: vnde est perpetua DEI aversatio & perpetua progressio ex peccato in peccatum: Vnde iustissimam sibi damnationem accersunt. Iustus igitur est Dominus & iusta & recta omnia iudicia eius. Exodus 7, v, 22. 23. & 8. v. 15. & 9. v. 34. 2. Paral. 36. v. 13. Act. 13. v. 46. Psal. 119. v. 137.

div.head: XXXII.
div.p: Hactenus eaquae ad 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 praecipuè spectant. Sequitur 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 sive Applicatio. Cuius talis erit ratio. Quemadmodum DEVS à summo & aeterno Decreto per inter-medios siue gradus siue media (quae effecta sunt illius Decreti) ad nos descendens gratiam & misericordiam suam patefacit: Ita nos per illos ipsos gradus & effecta (ordine effectorum servato) regrediendo ascendimus ad certitudinem Electionis nostrae, quam in vnica DEI misericordia fundatam esse firmissimè deprehendemus.

div.head: XXXIII.
div.p:
Quare secundùm ordinem Applicationis incipiendum erit à Regenerationis & Sanctificationis operibus, inde ad iustificationem, à iustificatione ad fidem & efficacem vocationem progrediendo: Ex quibus DEI donis si ea adsint (sunt enim ista DEI dona 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 ) certissimum de Electione
sua fidelis facere iudicium potest. Iohn 1. v. 13. Rom. 7. v. 6 1. Pet. 1. vers. 23. Ephes. 1. v. 5. Rom. 9. v. 29. Rom. 9. v. 11 Ephes. 1. v. 4.

div.head: XXXIIII.
div.p: Adest porrò in sanctis DEI filijs, Spiritus S. testimonium, testificantis Spiritui nostro, nos esse Filios DEI, per quem Spiritum intrepidè clamamus Abba Pater. Rom. 8. v. 14.15.16. Gal. 4. v. 6.

div.head: XXXV.
div.p: Si quis verò haec Spiritus & Regenerationis effecta in se nondum senserit, aut languida senserit, non tamen proptereà statuet ilico se esse ex Reproborum numero, aut de Salute sua desperare debet, quin potius ad verbum & voluntatem DEI revelatam confugiet, vt ei obediendo per fidem salutem consequatur. Mat. 17. v. 20, Marc. 11, v. • 3, Luc. 17. v. 6, Ioh. 17. v. 19. Heb. 10. v. 10. Rom. 10. v. 10.14, 15, 16, 17, 1. Cor. 11. v. 25, 26, Iohn 6. v. 44, 45, 2, Pet. 3, v. 9, Psa. 119, v. 105.

div.head: XXXVI.
div.p: Itaque sicut nec desperandum est homini de misericordia DEI quandiu non peccat ad mortem sive in Spiritum S. quum alij alijs tardiùs à DEO vocentur: quod celebre illud latronis in cruce cum Christo pendentis exemplum ostendit: ita nec securè peccandum est spe misericordiae divinae, ita argumentando: Si sum Electus, salvus fiam, quicquid fecero. Sicut enim ad salutem DEVS nos praedestinavit: Ita etiam ad hoc vocauit & elegit, vt sācti & inculpati essemus. Mat. 20. v. 3. & deinceps, Luc. 23, v. 40, & deinceps, 1 Iohn 5, v. 16, Mat. 12, v. 31, &c. Isa. 95, v. 7, 8, Heb. 3, 7, Gal. 6, 7, Ephes. 1 v. 4, & Cap. 2, v. 10, Rom. 8, v, 28, &c.

div.head: XXXVII.
div.p:
Vsus deni{que} huius doctrinae sunt isti: Primus, vt perpetuò
hanc doctrinam meditantes, emnem gloriam salutis nostrae vnico benignissimo DEO tribuamus, & grati infinitam eius bonitatem celebremus, qui nos in nobis perditos ex gratia in Christo Filio suo servare voluerit. Psal. 28. v. 2. & 35 v. 18. & ult. Psal. 51, v. 17. Ephes. 1. v. 3.4.5.6.7.11.

div.head: XXXVIII.
div.p: Secundus, vt gratitudinem nostram, per omnem vitam sanctitate & bonis operibus DEO probare, & firmam vocationem nostram efficere studeamus. 2. Pet. 1. v. 5.6.7.8.10.

div.head: XXXIX.
div.p: Tertius vsus, vt persuasi de diuina erga nos misericordia & amore in Christo firmissimum solatium hinc petamus & hauriamus in omni tentatione nostra, adversus omnia ignîta tela Diaboli, certò statuentes, neque mortem ne{que} vitam, ne{que} Angelos, ne{que} principatus, ne{que} potestates, ne{que} praesentia, ne{que} futura, ne{que} sublimitatem, ne{que} profunditatem, ne{que} vllam rem aliam creatam posse nos separare à Charitate Dei, quae est in Christo Iesu Domino nostro: Rom. 8. v. 38.39. Cui cum Patre & Spiritu S. sit Laus, honor & benedictio in omne aevum. Amen.

q.p:
O Profundas divitias tum Sapientiae, tum cognitionis DEI! quam inscrutabilia sunt ejus judicia & ejus
viae impervestigabiles? Quis enim cognovit mentem Domini? aut quis ei fuit a consilio? Aut quis prior dedit ei, & reddetur ei?

Tu homo exspectas a me responsum: & ego sum homo. Itaque ambo audiamus dicentem, O homo tu quis es? melior est fidelis ignorantia quam temeraria scientia. Quaere merita: non invenies nisi poenam. O altitudo! Petrus negat: Latro credit. O altitudo! Quaeris tu rationem? Ego expavescam altitudinem. Tu ratiocinare, ego mirabor: tu disputa, ego credam: altitudinem video, ad profundum non pervenio. Requievit Paulus, quia admirationem invenit: Vocat ille inscrutabilia DEI judicia: & tu scrutari venisti? Ille dicit investigabiles ejus vias: & tu vestigas?
